description: In this series we will dive into the second exam that is required for a viewer to achieve an MCSA in Windows 10. The topics will range from installation of Windows 10, post-installation configurations, applying images, various deployment tools as well as monitoring and servicing Windows 10 and more. Exam candidates are encouraged to watch both Windows 10 series for the MCSA exams.
descriptionMD: _This show is still in production.  We are updating the recording to reflect new features and interface.  The previously recorded one will be moved to Legacy when this updated version is complete._ In this series we will dive into the second exam that is required for a viewer to achieve an MCSA in Windows 10. The topics will range from installation of Windows 10, post-installation configurations, applying images, various deployment tools as well as monitoring and servicing Windows 10 and more. Exam candidates are encouraged to watch both Windows 10 series for the MCSA exams.
name: MCSA Windows 10 - 70-698 (UPDATED 2018)
subtitle: Installing and Configuring Windows 10

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike introduce Windows 10. They discuss how Windows operating systems have evolved over the years as well as highlighting need to know information specific to Windows 10. They explore system requirements, look at the differences between an upgrade and a clean installation, deployment options, editions and more!
episodes.title: Preparing for Installation

episodes.description: In this show, Mike and Cherokee continue to discuss considerations to help one choose the proper Windows 10 operating system edition, deployment method and even how to create the appropriate installation media. Cherokee walks through the process of three specific deployment methods including wipe and load, in-place upgrades and provisioning.
episodes.title: Preparing for Installation Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike take a look at Upgrade Readiness. Cherokee explains the release timline and how the release cadence effects enterprise upgrade deployments. She demonstrates how to use the workflow within the workspace.
episodes.title: Preparing for Installation Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at numerous ways to install Windows 10. They start with a demonstration using a command line interface tool, DiskPart. She shows how to manually create a bootable USB whilst comparing the diferences between that method versus the Windows media creation tool. They also discuss methods of installation such DISM, ICD, SysPrep, WDS, and SCCM.
episodes.title: Install Windows

episodes.description: In this show, Mike and Cherokee demonstrate how to perform a clean installation of Windows 10. They share resources and navigate this prpocess highlighting important and new steps.
episodes.title: Install Windows Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike talk about how to prepare for an inplace upgrade. They look at upgrade paths, considerations and mutiple options for migration deployment. Cherokee demonstrates what moving from Windows 8.1 Pro to Windows 10 Pro will look like.
episodes.title: Install Windows Part 3

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike explain how to instal Windows10 on a bootable USB. Cherokee introduces and explains the use case that drives Windows to go. She then shows how to use the Windows to go wizard as well as PowerShell syntax to perform the configuration manual if desired.
episodes.title: Install Windows Part 4

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike explain native boot.
episodes.title: Install Windows Part 5

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike continue discussing native boot. Cherokee picks up from the previous demo where a VHD was created. They look at another way to configure native boot but this time using DISM to create the VHD and then apply the image.
episodes.title: Install Windows Part 6

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike explore drivers. No they are not talking Nascar they look at how to install, pre-stage, update, disable, and roll back drivers and more.
episodes.title: Configure Devices and Drivers

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike explore drivers. No they are not talking Nascar they look at how to install, pre-stage, update, disable, and roll back drivers and more.
episodes.title: Configure Devices and Drivers Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike look at ways to customize the user interface. First, Cherokee shows the difference between left and right click Start Menu views. They also discuss tablet vs desktop mode, and various tile options.
episodes.title: Customize the Desktop

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike continue to look at ways to customize Windows 10 post install.
episodes.title: Customize the Desktop Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike explain ways to configure and optimize your system by taking advantage of Action Center and Taskbar. They look at ways to organize tiles within Action Center as well as how to control behavior via settings. They also begin to discuss several interesting features within Taskbar.
episodes.title: Action Center and Taskbar

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike continue to explore Taskbar settings and technologies. First, they look at the People app followed by several other newer apps as well as configuration options to make Windows 10 most efficient for individuals.
episodes.title: Action Center and Taskbar Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike look at ways windows 10 can assist users by leveraging accessibility options. They look at a number of ease of access settings such as Narrator, Magnifier, High Contrast, Closed Captions, Windows Speech Recognition and more! They also introduce Cortana and look at power settings.
episodes.title: Accessibility Options and Cortana

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike compare Microsoft browsers Internet Explorer 11 and Edge. They discuss several configuration options and features such as security and compatibility enhancements.
episodes.title: Internet Explorer and Edge

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike continue to discuss browsers. They demonstrate how to configure Edge as well as highlighting several fun feature enhancements.
episodes.title: Internet Explorer and Edge Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike discuss virtualization. They specifically look at Microsoft's version called Hyper-V. They cover system requirements, common terms and concepts. They also demonstrate how to enable Hyper-V in a Windows 10 system in a few different ways. Cherokee also shows how to create a virtual machine.
episodes.title: Configure Client Hyper-V

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike demonstrate several ways to create and work with virtual machines. Not only do they look at ways to create and manage in the GUI they also spend a great deal of time within PowerShell showcasing what you can do.
episodes.title: Configure Client Hyper-V Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike really delve into understanding when and how to use checkpoints. Cherokee demonstrates how to creat and manage them from both the GUI as well as PowerShell. They also look at the differences between standard and production checkpoints.
episodes.title: Configure Client Hyper-V Part 3

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike look at several virtual machine options. Cherokee discusses the difference in available options when a machine is powered on versus off. They also discuss and demonstrate Guest Integration Services.
episodes.title: Configure Client Hyper-V Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike explpore even more Hyper-v settings and options. Cherokee also demonstrates how to create virtual switches and adapters in both the GUI and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure Client Hyper-V Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Daniel take a look at some network resource sharing options. Cherokee shows where to check system configuration to verify if the system is Domain joined or part of a Workgroup. She also, demonstrates Homegroups. Although, Homegroups were removed from Windows 10 in version 1803 she covers how to set one up and connect to one preparing you for the exam.
episodes.title: Enterprise Implementations

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes continue to explore enterprise implementations. Specifically, they look at how to configure User Account Control (UAC) with group policy. Next, Cherokee gives a refresher on how to use the Windows Configuration Designer Tool.
episodes.title: Enterprise Implementations Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Daniel discuss different network configurations and profiles. Specifically, they look at guest or public, private and domain profiles. Cherokee shows where to configure those profile options as well as connecting to wifi and ethernet networks.
episodes.title: Configure Networking

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Daniel continue discussing networking. Specifically, they show where to configure Ipv4, IPv6 and name resolution settings.
episodes.title: Configure Networking Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Daniel introduce Windows Firewall and Windows Firewall with Advanced Security. They begin by demonstrating where to turn firewall profiles on or off. Next, advanced security settings in the GUI with to show how to create, delete, modify, disable, import/export rules and more!
episodes.title: Configure Networking Part 3

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Daniel continue to explore Windows Firewall and Windows Firewall with Advanced Security. However, they take a departure from the GUI and spend time in CMD demonstrating netsh as well as PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure Networking Part 4

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike introduce Virtual Private Networks (VPNs. They discuss why and how to implement one. Cherokee demonstrates how to configure a Remote Access Server (RAS)to facilitate the remote client connections.
episodes.title: Configure Networking Part 5

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike continue with a demonstration showing how to set up VPN. In the previous show they prepped the server and in this episode Cherokee shoes how to configure the connection from the client side. They also discuss additional security features such as app-triggered VPNs, traffic filters, and LockdownVPN.
episodes.title: Configure Networking Part 6

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike set the stage and explain disk and volume fundamentals. First, they discuss the differences and similarities between partioning schemes Master Boot Record (MBR) and GUID Partition Table (GPT). Next, they look at basic and Dynamics and the details of each.
episodes.title: Configure Disks and Volumes

episodes.description: In this episode, Mike and Cherokee continue to expound upon disk and volume fundamentals. Cherokee explains what Redundant Array of Independent/inexpensive Disk configurations are and why they may be helpful if studying for the 70-698 exam. Also, they disscus common file systems to help prepare for creating the most optimized volumes.
episodes.title: Configure Disks and Volumes Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike get hands on inside Disk Management. They begin navigating and explaining how to infer information about the disks in a system and really just getting familiar with the GUI.
episodes.title: Configure Disks and Volumes Part 3

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike spend time in disk management discussing and configuring volumes. Cherokee explains how and why one would choose one specific configuration over another.
episodes.title: Configure Disks and Volumes Part 4

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike spend time in command line interfaces to perform disk and volume management functions. Learn how to initialize disks, bring them online and format them. Also, Cherokee demonstrates how to perform conversions pertaining to basic and dynamic disks as well as partition schemes.
episodes.title: Configure Disks and Volumes Part 5

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike introduce a conversion tool called MBR2GPT that facilitates the partition scheme conversion on a bootable disk without removing the OS. They also spend a good deal of time showing different disk and volume configurations that can executed via PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure Disks and Volumes Part 6

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike introduce Storage Spaces. Cherokee likens the concept to familiar configurations previously demonstrated. She believes understanding this storage evolution is not only essential to passing the exam but also provide a strong understanding of how storage spaces works and improves on previous methods.
episodes.title: Configure Storage Spaces

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike look at several ways to help investigate various drive issues. They also discuss different tools to be aware of. Tune in to learn how Event Viewer, Device Manager, DiskPart, Powershell amd others play a role in disk troubleshooting.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Storage

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike continue to explore ways to troubleshoot disk issues. They specifically focus on diffent errors or disk/volume statuses one may encounter.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Storage Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Mike focus on different types of virtual drives. They explain the differences between .vhd and .vhdx drive options as well as ways to configure these drives. Specifically, they discuss fixed, dynamic, differencing and pass-through disks.
episodes.title: Create and Configure VHDs

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue to explore disk configurations. They look at ways to create drives from Hyper-V manager as well as PowerShell. Tune in to learn how to create fixed, dynamic, differencing and pass-through disks.
episodes.title: Create and Configure VHDs Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike discuss NTFS permissions. They cover import terms and concepts such as ACE,ACL,DACL, SAML and security principles. They explain why they are important as well as demonstrating a number of ways to configure them.
episodes.title: Configure File System Permissions

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike introduce share permissions and how they impact NTFS permissions. Cherokee demonstrates several ways to create and configure shares both in the GUI and through PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure File and Folder Sharing

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike introduce share permissions and how they impact NTFS permissions. Cherokee demonstrates several ways to create and configure shares both in the GUI and through PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure File and Folder Sharing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike take a look at how to set up and use OneDrive with File On Demand. Cherokee explains the status icons to help manage how files are stored and accessed.
episodes.title: Configure OneDrive and Files On Demand

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike explain the diffent types of apps and applications available. They look at way to install update and manage them. They also explain Windows Store for Business and Windows Store for Education. Lastly, Cherokee shows a couple of didfferent ways to manage startup options.
episodes.title: Configure apps

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at additional ways to work with apps. Specifically, they focus on sideloading. They discuss and demonstrate several installation options such as single vs multi user in addition to covering tools such as DISM and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure apps Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike introduce Windows Configuration Designer, formerly named Windows Image and Configuration Designer. They discuss what a provisioning packing is and then demonstrate how to create one for a customized experience.
episodes.title: Provision Packages

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue to discuss provision packages. They look at more advanced options and configuration service provider settings that will allow for custom provisioning.
episodes.title: Provision Packages Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike delve deeper into provisioning packages. They look a specific configuration service providers (CSP)called CleanPC. Cherokee explains how to use this CSP to create a .ppkg then apply it.
episodes.title: Provision Packages Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike start a discussion surrounding remote management options. The majority of this episode focuses on Remote Desktop. They cover different setting and demonstrate how one would connect.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue to explore GUI based remote management tools such as Remote Assistance, Easy Connect, Quick Assist and Microsoft Management Consoles (MMCs). They demonstrate how to use the various tool and explain under which circumstance one would choose to use one over another.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike approach yet another way to manage systems. Cherokee explains how WinRM works and how to set it up. THey look at ways to send commands with the Invoke Cmdlet as well as establish PSSession.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Management Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike explain Windows Updates. They cover several key terms such as explaining the difference between feature and quality updates. They also look at different Servicing Channels and explain why it is important to have a plan prior to release.
episodes.title: Configure Updates

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike delve into different setting options. They look the newer UI as well as Control Panel to see how to configure options such as enrolling into the insider preview program, managing update history and more!
episodes.title: Configure Updates Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike begin to introduce real-time monitoring tools. They explain how useful they can be and why we would use them. The first tool Cherokee demonstrates is Task Manager. She shows several options and setting to help display pertinent system information.
episodes.title: Monitor Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at more monitoring tools. Specifically, they explore Resource Manager, Performance Manager, and Reliability Monitor. Cherokee also demonstrates how perform common functions of these tools such as create and configure counters and data collector sets.
episodes.title: Monitor Windows: Performance/Resource Monitor

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at different ways Event Viewer can be used. Cherokee demonstrates how to filter logs, create custom ones, export and clear logs.
episodes.title: Monitor Windows: Event Viewer

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike introduce Event Subscriptions. They look at the various prerequisites  as well as how to configure both the collector and source systems.
episodes.title: Monitor Windows: Event Subscriptions

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at different ways you can monitor printers. They talk about common terms, topology designs, and troubleshooting techniques.
episodes.title: Monitor Windows: Printers and Indexing

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at different ways you can monitor printers. They talk about common terms, topology designs, and troubleshooting techniques.
episodes.title: Monitor Windows: Printers and Indexing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike spend time looking at how Windows Defender has evolved and has different options available to keep systems protected. Cherokee demonstrates where to check the settings to keep your system protected.
episodes.title: Windows Defender Options

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike begin discussing recovery options. First, they introduce restore points. Cherokee demonstrates where to configure the system and how to create them. They also look at how to create a recovery drive.
episodes.title: System and Data Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue discussing recovery options. Cherokee picks up from a previous episode after reverting to a previous checkpoint. She then navigates through options with toe troubleshooting settings. She also shows how to perform more granular recovery by using file history ond OneDrive to recover individual files. Lastly, she reminds to use Device Manage to perform driver rollbacks if problematic drivers are the root cause.
episodes.title: System and Data Recovery Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Daniel look an older backup method called Backup and Restore. This method spawned from Windows 7 and although it not the preferred current method Cherokee demonstrates how to use it for backwards compatibility. Next, they discuss a command line utility WBAdmin. Tune in to see these tools backup and perform restore functions.
episodes.title: System and Data Recovery Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Daniel take a look at some network resource sharing options. Cherokee shows where to check system configuration to verify if the system is Domain joined or part of a Workgroup. She also, demonstrates Homegroups. Although, Homegroups were removed from Windows 10 in version 1803 she covers how to set one up and connect to one preparing you for the exam.
episodes.title: Homegroups and Workgroups

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Aubri talk about domains and Active Directory Domain Services. Cherokee demonstrates various ways domain services can be accessed. First, they look at how one would join a system by communicating with an Active directory Domain Controller. Next, she uses Azure to connect to a domain via Azure AD. Lastly, the ladies cover terms associated with Active Directory Domains to be familiar with.
episodes.title: Domain Join Options

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Aubri cover various authentication methods. The ladies compare and explain Microsoft Passport and Windows Hello. They also look at other biometric authentication options as well as dynamic lock.
episodes.title: Passport and Hello

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Justin spend time in both the GUI and PowerShell looking at ways to configure services. Next, they explore Device Manager follwed up with Task Scheduler.
episodes.title: Configure Advanced Management Tools

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Justin continue discussing advanced management tools. First, they spend time looking at how to create a custom management console with MMC and snap-ins. They also, revisit Task Scheduler, this time incorporating a PowerShell script. Lastly, Cherokee demonstrates MDM Migration Analysis tool (MMAT)a useful tool to help perform analysis for Group Policy to MDM migrations.
episodes.title: Configure Advanced Management Tools Pt.2
